definition: lit. set up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); fig. instant effect/quick results
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
pole
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
picture/image/film/movie/photograph/reflection/shadow/trace

sentences.english: Music therapy does not cure at once.
sentences.chinese: 音樂療法並不能立竿見影。

sentences.english: This is an immediate consequence of the JOSH stack.
sentences.chinese: 這就是JOSH組合立竿見影的效果。

sentences.english: The results from repeal were both immediate and amazing.
sentences.chinese: 撤銷禁酒令的結果是最立竿見影和最傳奇的。

sentences.english: And it would have the advantage of an almost instant off switch.
sentences.chinese: 它的優勢是將會產生立竿見影的效果。

sentences.english: A big change in an exchange rate seems at first glance that it should have an immediate impact.
sentences.chinese: 乍看之下，匯率大變似乎該有立竿見影的效果。

sentences.english: If we stop eating meat completely, the cooling effect will be almost immediate.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們徹底停止喫肉，其冷卻效果幾乎是立竿見影。

sentences.english: He looks for an immediate return on that ad buy.
sentences.chinese: 對於購買的廣告，他尋求立竿見影的回報。

sentences.english: The lesson was crystal clear, and its effects were immediate.
sentences.chinese: 夢給他上的一課像水晶般透明，而且立竿見影。

sentences.english: If you are looking for instant-gratification, try a 5k.
sentences.chinese: 如果你尋求的是立竿見影的效果，那麼試試5km吧。

sentences.english: No other diet or weight-loss approach is remotely as effective as bariatric surgery.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼節食或減肥方法比減肥手術更加立竿見影。

sentences.english: They're an on-demand group accustomed to seeing immediate results.
sentences.chinese: 他們是一個按需團體，習慣於看到立竿見影的效果。

sentences.english: Persuasion is great for immediate effect, but learning matters over the long-haul.
sentences.chinese: 勸說有立竿見影的效果，學習卻是長途旅行。

definition: to eliminate dust (i.e. filter out suspended particles)
to treat only the symptoms but not the root cause
medication/herbal remedy
to alleviate stress
lit. four ounces can move a thousand catties (idiom)/fig. to achieve much with little effort
tense situation/standoff
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
auriculotherapy (ear acupuncture)
holistic diagnosis and treatment (TCM)
antihistamine
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
Tiger Balm (medicine)/jack of all trades (and master of none)(slang)
to get a slender figure/slimming
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
lit. to prescribe the right medicine for an illness (idiom); fig. to study a problem to find the right way to solve it/to take appropriate steps
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
